How fast your site loads is a huge factor in how many visits you get. One of the biggest names in performance testing is YSlow. A high score on YSlow is a good indicator that your site is performing well. Many of the scores can be improved with a little bit of tweaking to your .htaccess file.Add this snippet to the top of your .htaccess file.Header unset ETagFileETag None&lt;FilesMatch "\.(css|js)$"&gt; SetOutputFilter DEFLATE &lt;/FilesMatch&gt; &lt;FilesMatch "\.(mov|otf|eot|ttf|ico|pdf|flv|jpg|jpeg|png|gif|js|css|swf)$"&gt; Header set Expires "Thu, 15 Apr 2010 20:00:00 GMT" &lt;/FilesMatch&gt;Now for a little breakdown of what each part does.This part disables E-Tags so not to cause conflicts.Header unset ETagFileETag NoneThis gzips your css and javascript files resulting in a smaller transfer size.&lt;FilesMatch "\.(css|js)$"&gt; SetOutputFilter DEFLATE &lt;/FilesMatch&gt;This adds a far future Expires header to most static files you will have. &lt;FilesMatch "\.(mov|otf|eot|ttf|ico|pdf|flv|jpg|jpeg|png|gif|js|css|swf)$"&gt; Header set Expires "Thu, 15 Apr 2010 20:00:00 GMT" &lt;/FilesMatch&gt;With these few changes your score in YSlow should dramatically improve. Any other .htacces tricks? Let me know in the comments.
